instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no PP3V42 or PPBUS
threads.message: Good morning. I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no green light on the charger, PP3V42 is .43V and PPBUS is .5V. I checked PPDCIN which is 18v and pin 4 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> which has 6.8V on it so I assume that is working based on measurements taken from another board. I also checked and do not have any short on PPBUS so I am wondering if <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> is causing my issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no PP3V42 or PPBUS
threads.message: something has to be shorting PP3V42 to GND.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no PP3V42 or PPBUS
threads.message: So I forgot There were a few corroded components by the SMC as well as two broken traces, to the two lines to the right of the SMC. I replaced all of the baddies and repaired the two broken traces and now have PP3V42, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, CPU VCORE is at 1.8v. The only problem now is no image or backlight

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no PP3V42 or PPBUS
threads.message:
Do you get USB activity?
I recommend to reball SMC, if you noted corrosion near it.
